website_summaries.verdict: Very lightweight axes at a decent price work great for people who are not strong enough to control the larger or more traditional-looking axes in competition.
pros: Can be thrown easily at a high speed
Sturdy and well made for the price
Comes with a protective sheath for carrying
cons: The paracord wrapping has a tendency to come loose quickly

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Loved these. Had to spray paint them so that we wouldn’t lose them if they missed target. Everyone enjoyed throwing these at our wedding.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Deyhle

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun to be had!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are probably too sharp out of the box. One piece, so nothing to break. First day one of the hawks made contact with the handle of another and cut into the wrapped handle. I rewrapped them in tan camo. They look better than the original. Took very little time. If you are worried about the paracord coming unraveled just burn the ends.
customer_reviews.author: maynard

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GIFT FOR YOUR MAN!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this for my boyfriend for Christmas and this set is SO NICE!!! They are well designed, look pristine and are exactly what I was looking for. The photo with the axe in hand is deceiving, I think it looked smaller in the photo but seems much larger in person - which is what I was hoping for. This is exactly what I was looking for and SOG makes the best weaponry. If you want a nice set, definitely go for this one!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: I may write another review if I get better with them
customer_reviews.text: Trees are living things too. Tomahawks are well weighted and have proven effective at a range of 60ft, I got them yesterday. I may write another review if I get better with them... feels like throwing a baseball. Expect to make alterations to the paracord as the end bits are subject to loosening after a dozen throws but this item makes for a fun time with friends in the backyard. Sheathe is nylon
customer_reviews.author: James Potter

customer_reviews.title: These are lightweight but sturdy, easy to throw
customer_reviews.text: These are lightweight but sturdy, easy to throw, sharp and come with a sheath that holds all of them. I don't love the sheath design but it is functional so it is good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Cabe Cox

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend against buying these throwing hawks
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend against buying these throwing hawks. The paracord wrapped on the handle came undone on the first throw. What you are left with is a sharp edge handle that digs into your skin and makes it difficult to throw unless you have prosthetic hands. Very disappointed and would strongly recommend against buying.
customer_reviews.author: vietcon

customer_reviews.title: weak handles
customer_reviews.text: Take of string handles and wrap tape is your best bet. These are sharp so they just slice through the handles. Order some color tape to so you can wrap the handles. Best throwing axes out there thou.
customer_reviews.author: Fister

customer_reviews.title: Fun for trees and logs!
customer_reviews.text: Overall a fun product. I've been throwing them at trees and logs and if you toss them right, they go in pretty deep. Definitely have to sharpen the blades after use as they get dinged up fairly easy. The weight seems great as well, not to heavy or too light.
customer_reviews.author: Ray IV

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners or kids
customer_reviews.text: These will be thinner and smaller than you think. The videos online will show you being able to stick both ends in a target, but the side opposite the blade will be too dull. You'll have to sharpen that part. If you hit the target off center these will bounce pretty well. Easy to loose in tall grass. One of ours bounced off and hit a rock and chipped the blade. Think of this as something between a throwing knife and a heavier handheld axe, that leans more towards the throwing knife, comparatively.
customer_reviews.author: Kid Judas

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and sharp!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome throwing axe. Lightweight, easy to handle, sharp and accurate Very nice job making this. The only issue is the parachute cord handle. Horrible design. How did we go wrong on this? Just make a leather handle or something. The parachute cord come unraveled after only a couple throws and is super annoying and gets in the way I wrapped it back up and put duck tape over it. Appearance doesn’t look as good now but it holds it in place Fix you handle and you have 5 star product
customer_reviews.author: Lee M. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: So much fun. I rewrapped the handles as the wrapping came pretty loose. These are nowhere near regulation, they are nice and light. My wife and I throw for hours in the yard. They work great with a 2" thick foam arrow target and the target lasts for a long time if you stick the point end instead of the blade end. Also if the make contact with each other, the wrapping won't get cut like if you use the blade end. Very fun.
customer_reviews.author: Liberty

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect for throwing at the target I made in my ...
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for throwing at the target I made in my back yard. Easy to learn and pretty accurate once you get the hang of it. They are thin, and the grip cording will eventually wear off. But they're fun to throw and great for what they are. Just don't think they're going to be thick and heavy like an axe you'd use for chopping wood.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: For the Price they are Okay
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight, and on the small side, but honestly that makes them perfect for starting out. The issue i had is the nylon wrapping the handles is terrible. The ends weren't melted so they came apart. After re-lacing and melting the ends, 2 of them seem good go (minus them sliding up the handle) while the 3rd took a hit on the board cutting the nylon off. Without the nylon these are borderline unusable with the lack of grip left. Plan to dip in rubber, see how that does.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The blade is poorly made and dulls after a dozen throws. If I could I would return these instantly and maybe try the other SOG throwing axe. For what the small pack of 3 are priced, it totally isn't worth it and they do not hold up. This is coming from a customer that has never written a bad review if it tells yousomething. Also the SOG throwing knives are garbage too. Just like the axes. The blade dulls super fast. It's a shame cause SOG usually creates good products and I just got the luck of buying 2 really bad products from them. I wish I could speak to somebody about it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids.. not great if you're used to full size normal tomahawk.
customer_reviews.text: This is very very light weight and nothing like a full sized wood handled tomahawk. I got these for our Trail Life Troop tho, and most of the boys are younger so this will actually work out well for them. They are not toys however.. very sharp.. so train them well. The case is a bit of a pain getting them in and out.. but it's a fine way to store them. It's not something you can operate quickly tho.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Burtz

customer_reviews.title: wife loved this
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to do an axe throwing date night. The wife wanted to try it. Local places charge about $60-70 for a couple to go one time. I got these on sale and was able to build my own target. I think I'm invested about $80 total into the setup. They work well. Took my wife about 9 axes to get them to start sinking into the target. So, easy to learn. It's all about distance from you to the target. Fun camping activity. Fun backyard activity. Probably not super safe for kids. But, practice safety things and your fine. They come very sharp so keep out of reach of children.
customer_reviews.author: Kwabina

customer_reviews.title: Great little hatchet!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought these hatchets would be larger but they turned out to be perfect. The size makes it easy for one-handed throwing for adults and two handed for smaller children. My neighbor's 8 year old LOVED throwing these. They are light, well balanced and durable. One gentleman at the party we bought these for actually embedded the handle into the target. We got the hatchet out and no damage was done. They are light, accurate and easy to throw. The picture is a standard WATL 4x4 target before painting and you can see the scale of the size of the hatchet. I am very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Deathdeelr

customer_reviews.title: Fun but...
customer_reviews.text: These are a blast! I think they would do better without this silly black coating because all it does is chip off, makes some sharp burrs. The 550 cord handles also might as well be left off since they do not hold up to use. This would lower the price and make them even more fun because one could purchase two sets!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Paine

customer_reviews.title: The handles unravel
customer_reviews.text: The ax itself is a terrific design. After just one throw the first corded handle began unraveling. It went downhill from there. We tried electrical tape on the ends to hold it tight but probably needed super glue, as another customer used. Why the manufacturer has not upgraded the handle after years of comments seems negligent to me. We are returning them and going with a new style.
customer_reviews.author: Pam R.

customer_reviews.title: Small, but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Small, lightweight, but sturdy. 8yo used it too and was easy to throw. We played for several hours with about 8 different adults playing. The hand grip held up, but would be nice if it was rubber grip. Definitely smaller than expected, but was just fine for what we were using for. My friend made us an axe target and everything was perfect. 3 Tomahawks came with 1 black storage pouch. Fits snug, it’s perfect. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TanyaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These axes are way smaller than the picture depicts of them. They have very little weight and are more equivalent of throwing knives. I kept them as it gives a variety of things to have to throw at our axe target, but in my opinion they are not even near worth the cost. Your better off buying a good eastswing axe if you are looking at an axe you can truly trow.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Reeder

customer_reviews.title: Good price. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: OK for the price. We are beginners so didnt want to spend too much. Axes seem sturdy enough. Paracord handles very loosely wrapped. I don't see them lasting long. Also makes it tricky to throw with the handle slipping a lot. The sheath is nice. It would be even nicer if all three axes fit it. They barely squeeze in and the velcro straps arent big enough for the three handles. We will wear theae out then buy something better.
customer_reviews.author: Venturous

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: they throw very well. They are very light and super sharp out the package. Has held up to hundreds of throws so far except for a chip oit of the tip of the blade on one. At this price it would be hard to find anything comparable.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Isn't everything made by SOG great
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my kids to start throwing Tomahawks. Very fun, simply made and effective. Not sure if it would be good for other camping activities but you could carry one hiking or in camp as they are so light. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I knew they were smaller than my other Tomahawks after I read the description. But I was still a little taken back by how small and light they are. I have to admit I was skeptical about their performance. But they're durable and finely sharpened. I really like my other bigger SOG hawks, but I really love these little guys. I might even buy a second set. These make a fine addition to anyone's collection of throwing blades.
customer_reviews.author: MelodicChronic

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: These are so much fun. They are flat little axes that anyone can throw. We did bend one of them a bit after a few throws but it still works just fine. The paracord handles held up to a lot of throwing which was unexpected. I recommend painting them some bright colors because when someone misses a target outside they can travel pretty far in the air and on the ground!
customer_reviews.author: C.Beatty

customer_reviews.title: Better learn how to wrap paracord.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these axes for my backyard throwing target. They are light weight, and spin nicely. The entire ax is steel, with the grip being lightly wound paracord grip. The biggest problem with this is once another ax slides close to its fellows on the target, the paracord gets cut and frayed. Any barbs on the metal will cut or scratch your hands if you don't rewrap the handles. My next purchase will be wooden/fiberglass handles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap throwing tomahawk but not very durable
customer_reviews.text: I like these overall but be aware the metal edge (which is quite sharp by the way) is not very sturdy and nicked/folded in spots on the first day of use. The para cord handle design is not great either because if you are throwing at a target and it gets stuck, it is very easy to cut by throwing another hawk. These take some skill and I think they are over all a good product but wish they were sturdier. At the price however, I still recommend them for their intended purpose -- to learn and practice throwing.
customer_reviews.author: honest abe

customer_reviews.title: Throws straight and feels great
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best throwing axes I've used. Throwing it at plank wood did bend one of the edges, but it holds up nicely and feels good in your hand. It is really evenly balanced and throws straight
customer_reviews.author: Steven Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Did not last as expected
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used these on no more than ten occasions having fun for 20 minutes each time. Really sorry to find the webbing on the handles unraveling and disintegrating with such little use. Stored inside, and our range is undercover. Very disappointed. When the webbing goes it’s hard to let the axe slide through your hand. We can’t use these as they are. Darn. ,
customer_reviews.author: Kokoro

customer_reviews.title: Holy Crap This is Too Much Fun
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe how well these are made, especially for the price. My friend and I have been using these all summer. The are sharp as heck, well balanced and crafted well. It was a reminiscent/joke gift. Now I own my own and we are back into target throwing. You could even take these hiking for use in kindling and cutting (the temptation to throw it though...) The only negative is that they are so sharp one nicked the cordage handle and we had to replace it. We got the neon/glow in the dark cordage as it makes finding missed throws much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I followed the advice of others and placed a thick clear coat paint over the ropes and super glued the knots. It took several coats as the roads sucked up the clear coat. We have since thrown them thousands of times at campouts and parties and the rope handle is still fine. Great and fun. Good for kids and most ladies that throw prefer these to larger traditional axes.
customer_reviews.author: Jami Jackson

customer_reviews.title: works as expected  smaller then you would expect
customer_reviews.text: i built an axe target in my garage. its too rainy to move it out side. a normal axe is to heavy to throw inside, these are between throwing axes and darts, i bought a 2nd pair and painted them red. we throw them in the garage every day. like darts. most of the cords are off the axes from other axes hitting them. if they do break i will buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Patton

customer_reviews.title: Really Cool Axes but a little on the small side.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the way these axes are made, but they are a little smaller that I expected. I had thrown some axes at a restaurant that I went to and kind of expected these to be bigger. The description was accurate in the listing, I just didn't pay enough attention. I still use them, but we throw them at a different target. Quick shipping and good seller.
customer_reviews.author: zaphod

customer_reviews.title: Broken within 2 weeks - Good customer service
customer_reviews.text: Update: SOG worked quickly to replace the axe and sent a new one over. I've had no issues with the axes since the replacement. Quick and easy customer service The axes were a little smaller than I anticipated, but they looked nice and flew alright. After the first week they started chipping a bit and every axes cord handle wrapping loosened. And as of today one of the axes completely snapped in half. Very unhappy with the durability, especially since I threw the axes less than 50 times before they broke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: axeman is happy
customer_reviews.text: These were bought as a birthday present for my son, a.k.a Axeman. He is very adapted at throwing and wanted to try axes, since he has pretty much always used knives. Axeman is happy. They are easy to throw, have a great weight, and after a lot of throws , they are still sharp. They also hold up really well after throwing. some chip and dull. But these are still in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: debra ann wallace

customer_reviews.title: Fun for whole family
customer_reviews.text: These three are equally weighted and configured so they throw consistently. Somewhat small in size but great for a beginner like myself and my daughter. Fun for the whole family.
customer_reviews.author: ronald e.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Good purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as throwing axes. Good quality, very sharp. The braided cording came loose on one of the axes the first time I used them but was easy to retie. The weight is evenly distributed so it takes practice to hit your target. I imagine a heavy headed axe would hit blade first every time. Regardless, these could be multipurpose. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Williams

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn, and wood targets last longer than large hatchets
customer_reviews.text: We started out with larger hatchets, and we were burning through 2x6's pretty fast. These Tomahawks are easy to learn, and they are a lot easier to play with and easy on the arms. They have a good edge, and they stick in wood real well. We ordered a second set after the first one was so enjoyable. I'd recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: MHall

customer_reviews.title: tldr: not good weight for throwing. break easy.
customer_reviews.text: Very light and compact, which means they're very mobile. Unfortunately that doesn't really outweigh how ineffective they are. It takes an extremely practiced hand to throw something with such poor weight characteristics accurately and with enough power to do damage. To confound the issue further, these tomahawks tend to snap at the neck when thrown with proper force. I've broken two of my three in half through normal, infrequent use. I have probably thrown them four to six hundred times in the six or so months I've owned them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These little throwing axes are great for target practice
customer_reviews.text: These little throwing axes are great for target practice. The parachute cord needs to be either re-tied constantly or throw a little tape on the bottom. Other than that, great throwing axes. These are extremely sharp, certainly not a toy.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Hashey

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced and fun to throw....
customer_reviews.text: Look, they're cheap, lightweight and if you ding the hell out of the blade they're easy to file back down and sharpened. But they are super lightweight so if you are used to throwing heavier acts they're not so great. But they're good especially for someone who is looking to try out throwing for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, easy to carry balanced well for throwing.
customer_reviews.text: Great price, light weight should last a long time, sturdy enough for beginners but quality for the person that wants to carry and use out and about. The scabbard is light weight and easily attaches your belt for easy carry when hiking or camping.
customer_reviews.author: Richard K.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.text: These are very light. So light that its hard to make long throws with them yet you get very dangerous ricochets if you are too close. The paracord wraps are useless. They are so loose that they slid up to the head after a few throws. I ended up removing them. The finish underneath is pretty bad and inconsistent from one to the next. I regret this purchase at this price.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: These little things are so much fun to throw
customer_reviews.text: What a freaking blast! These little things are so much fun to throw! While they are definitely small and light they still hold up to a whole day of throwing. I would like to see more weight on them but for what you get, three hawks and a case you really can’t complain.
customer_reviews.author: SMG

customer_reviews.title: Light & Well Balanced
customer_reviews.text: Very good throwing tomahawks. I will add two things I really wish they would improve on, first the rope handle comes apart, comes loose, moves around, messing up your aim, even after using tools to tighten. Secondly the metal they use to make it seems very soft, after a hit from another tomahawk, it has already taken a chunk of metal from it. The handle is to more concerning/annoying part.
customer_reviews.author: Bear Fam

customer_reviews.title: Tough and Sharp
customer_reviews.text: I waiting to write this until I had them about 6 months. Havent bent one yet. I figured as light as they are it would be the first thing I did.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Scout tested
customer_reviews.text: Over all the axes were great! We took these to a two day scout camp with 11-14 year old boys. it was a great purchase. They were used almost nonstop both days. The ax held its edge really well, considering how many time it was thrown into the dirt and rocks. I would have give it a 5 star, but... the para-cord was shredded after about an hours use. SOG should either get rid of the para-cord all together or replace it with a more durable product. Really a fun product.
customer_reviews.author: Janele Leatham

customer_reviews.title: fun starter throwing axes
customer_reviews.text: These are THIN, and lightweight. They are Sharp as F* when you first get them. The paracord wrap doesn't last long, and then they become too sharp on the handle edges. If you've been to axe throwing in a commercial setting, these are not those. These are thinner, more like knives. Fun, but don't expect them to last long.
customer_reviews.author: mdisher

customer_reviews.title: These are sharp!!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought that I would have more luck throwing these, but not yet. Still developing my skill. With that being said, these are a nice set of tomahawks. I bought 2 sets and if I need to, I will buy more of these. A great buy. A word of caution...while I was cleaning them, I nicked my finger and it bled. So watch out lol...these guys are sharp.
customer_reviews.author: aerobear109

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Too light to throw Keep looking!
customer_reviews.text: They are light weight all right so light weight they aren’t worth buying! This is gonna be smaller and crappier then you can imagine. The company seems to really care, they offered replacement and refund immediately so if you do buy it and don’t like it at least you can return it!
customer_reviews.author: Ian Sayre

customer_reviews.title: Great party favors. My friends love throwing these at the trees around a bonfire!
customer_reviews.text: Small enough for the women to throw. Tough enough for the men to throw. I got these for my bug out bag, but these quickly turned into a party favorite one drunken night. I'm not condoning drinking and throwing axes, but I live in the country and can do Whateber TF I want. Sure to stick in a tree if hit in either side of the head. Bring out your inner viking or use for sporting competitions IDC. But they are fun little buggers.
customer_reviews.author: CorganMFA

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best impulse buys I have made in a long time. The cord around the handles have held up way longer than I expected. They are a new and exciting form of entertainment when we have people over to our house or cabin. I plan on buying a second set soon so we can play more!
customer_reviews.author: Master Chief

customer_reviews.title: Paracord handles won't stand up to actual usage, wrap them in tape.
customer_reviews.text: Great throwing axes! Only drawback is the Paracord handles almost immediately started fraying and unraveling. I realized that expecting them to last during actual usage wasn't a realistic expectation and promptly wrapped them in bright blue exterior painter's tape (pictured). The wrap of silver ductwork tape was to additionally aid locating them in brush when I miss the target and backstop.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Swall

customer_reviews.title: Good as an entry level set for practice, but purchase a sharpening stone too.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for a starter set of throwing hawks, would make a good gift. Make sure to buy 100 feet of paracord, because the wrapped cord handles on these tend to get shredded quickly. The steel is not as high quality as I would like, so they need sharpening after each practice session, but you get what you pay for. Overall the fun these axes brought me was worth far in excess of what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fault in two
customer_reviews.text: So I honestly do love them but I can't give his a high rating cuz after 5 throws one of them snapped and the other have a few chips in the blade, the chips in the other two came after a couple hours tho. Now the two that didn't snap still work great and I love them. Would give better rating if it wasn't for the one breaking. Update: had another one break in the exact same spot as the last one so pay attention to the metal where the rope ends and it just goes to pure metal.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Everhart

customer_reviews.title: outstanding value for endless fun with family and your buddies.
customer_reviews.text: kids have beat the hell out of these and they're an outstanding value. No, they're not high dollar throwing pieces, but chances are you are not an expert thrower lol. Get em, they're fun for the whole family. I'd touch up the tips on a grinder first.
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product and real reasonable price. You cant go wrong here!
customer_reviews.text: I like my bigger tomahawk best, but its not for throwing unless you know what your doing. Once I found my mark with speed and spin, I pulled off a Robin Hood shot. It shaved a chunk out of the handle of hawk I previously threw. SOG is good quality carbon steel and come with a razor sharp edge! It'd be difficult to find better quality. And if you did, I can only imagine how much you'd have to pay.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb B.

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: These were much skinnier than I anticipated, but overall a good product for a great price. 15 minutes into throwing I hit another hatches handle and cut the paracord right off. Not a big deal but would prefer something more practical for the handle. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: F for durability.
customer_reviews.text: Throwing into wood only, these things bent and/or broke the tips of each blade within the first few throws. The weren’t cheap (pricing) so I’d like to think they would have held up a little better than what they did. Can still be thrown but balance is off.
customer_reviews.author: Primalfear

customer_reviews.title: Durability issues..
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these...I really did. They throw perfectly, just like my Fasthawk, but the durability is just not there. Cracked edges, and the constant annoyance of the failing paracord make it just impossible for me to truly recommend. I challenge SOG to do better.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lyman

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind these are small. However they come in a nice carrier, lightweight to carrier compared to full size. Anyone can use them to practice throwing in your back yard, desert, woods, etc. They are sharp, potentially lethal so handle with extreme care.
customer_reviews.author: OldSchoolCollector

customer_reviews.title: Look Good
customer_reviews.text: I have not used these tomahawks yet but they look good and I expect that they will perform well. If I am disappointed once I do use them, I will revise my review but don't expect that to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Pooh

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I took these tomahawks to an axe throwing range in St. Louis, MO. They lasted 1 hour... 550 cord fell apart and the weights were off.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Great mininhatchets, good for cutting open cans of Coors ...
customer_reviews.text: Great mininhatchets, good for cutting open cans of Coors for shotgunning. Can’t advise on the throwing capability yet, I’m building myself up for the big leagues.
customer_reviews.author: nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Good balance & sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Good balance & sturdy. Seem to be holding up well to abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Icemann

customer_reviews.title: Can't say enough good about these throwing axes. So glad I thought of these and found your product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these throwing axes for my 2 nephews and grandson. They absolutely love the outdoors and I want to promote that any way I can. They all hunt and fish and responsibly own knives and firearms. They still "play" in the woods at 17, 15 and 13 years of age. I thought these throwing axes would give them another spin on target practice and boy was I right. They love them and the quality is excellent. Thye came practically overnight. Thank you for the fast service and quality product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: My son-in-law is hard to buy for. I'm hoping he likes his 'axes'.
customer_reviews.author: Kjo

customer_reviews.title: Fun... but poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: These little axes are so much fun, but the quality of the handles is horrible. I'm planning on keeping them because I think I can fix them, but just know the material used to make the handles shredded the second time we used them.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I expected a daddy axe and got a baby axe, but it wasn't that bad even though it was tiny. It was so cute. It made me happy. They threw fine. If you hit an axe on another axe it will cut the cord off. They were thoroughly fun for what I needed them for. If you want something cheap that you don't mind losing - this product is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Cole Davis

customer_reviews.title: Light sharp busy hard to chop with
customer_reviews.text: While thin for throwing and very sharp they have very little mass and are hard to hand chop with. Still they are vey useful and combined with a good camping shovel are a great addition for my pack
customer_reviews.author: JadeID

customer_reviews.title: The look on their face when they here the “Thhiitt” sound and it sticks
customer_reviews.text: These are well worth the money. Iv had my kids and their friends who are in their thirtys and myself throwing these a couple 100 times at a 18 inch dia log in past 2 days . We are not professionals lol so a lot of misses. But they are easier for beginners to stick than throwing knives so they keep the motivation going Just watch they will bounce off if a bad throw farther than knives. Start out slow.
customer_reviews.author: Joe barto

customer_reviews.title: Great Light and small tomahawks for throwing
customer_reviews.text: Not indestructible, as I broke a blade in the first 30 days, but still a good set. I did overuse the one that I broke, I kept one of the three in the case and never thrown, so it would be pristine when the zombie apocalypse comes I'd be ready. Seriously, a great set of throwing tomahawks, All one piece of metal, with a wrapped cord handle. Sweet, but small. A step between a knife and a hatchet. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Yoder

customer_reviews.title: “SOG” is ualityou at its best.
customer_reviews.text: SOG is well known for great knives and I was confident these throwing axes would be of the same quality. I wasn’t disappointed when I received them. If you’re looking for great throwing knives for backyard fun these axes are the answer.
customer_reviews.author: CJLevesque

customer_reviews.title: For new throwers, fun competition between friends, or just honeing your skills.
customer_reviews.text: Great for dead tree trunks. Awesome for target's. It takes a little getting used to because they are lighter than the tactical tomahawk, but they are great for the beginning throwers. With supervision, I believe that these will be great for anyone who is new to the art of throwing.
customer_reviews.author: tdStandingwater

customer_reviews.title: Smaller, lighter hawks. Only one sheath for all three hawks.
customer_reviews.text: Only 4 stars because came with ONE sheath to fit all 3 hawks. Not a good fit.... the tomahawks themselves are well made and pretty balanced for being smaller and lighter than other hawks.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: Wow these things are sharp!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what I was expecting in throwing axes, but I didn't expect them to be able to shave the hair off my arm out of the package...but they did! Stick well, when I throw them well. Well balanced - light, but not too light. Excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Auburn

customer_reviews.title: great tomahawks.
customer_reviews.text: it takes a minute to get the right feel for them, I ended up having to throw them kind of high and at the right distance, but once you figure that out, they are a ton of fun. well built, solid, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: dr. egg

customer_reviews.title: Product needs an update with better handles
customer_reviews.text: I love this hawks, they are fun to throw but the paracord handle is not good at all. I tried a few things to keep the cords in place but after throwing them a few times, it will get loose no matter what.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Endara Crespo

customer_reviews.title: They work but need extra attention
customer_reviews.text: They work but string comes loose. I put small amounts of epoxy on the string ends so they dont unravel. Also painted head orange so they easier to find in the bushes.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Great throwing axes for kids or Adults.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these SOG Tomahawks. The blades came sharp but I did sharpen the back points but after throwing them for a few days I realized I didn’t need to unless you plan on throwing them backwards, which I don’t. Love SOG products. -Robert Fayetteville, NC
customer_reviews.author: Robert Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Worth it if you have money to burn
customer_reviews.text: Kind of a tough review for me because I liked them but I feel like they could be a little bigger and the paracord came undone after little use. They were definitely sharp enough out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Chainpuller

customer_reviews.title: Mostly ok.
customer_reviews.text: But as terrible as I had feared. Very light, so they doing have that satisfying heft and thunk when they hit. The cord wrap has to go immediately. It doesn't feel good in the hand and comes apart quite quickly. Definitely will be tons better with new handle scales.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Fun little throwing hatchets, yes they are light but they are easy to throw and don't require a lot of effort like bigger throwing hatchets and tomahawks
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Smith

customer_reviews.title: The throwing axes themselves are fine. They are on the small side for my ...
customer_reviews.text: These are just ok. The handle is covered with paracord but that didn't last very long at all. It's all torn up. Need to figure out what I can cover the handles with that will last. The throwing axes themselves are fine. They are on the small side for my teenage son's big hands, but he likes throwing them.
customer_reviews.author: Tan Man Baseball Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: My step son originally purchased a set for my husband for father's day. After having fun with them the first day, I immediately ordered a second set. They are light enough, balanced and easy to throw.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Guerin-Staples

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on a whim before a fourth of July party and thought maybe they'd be a hit. By the end of the day I wished I had ordered two sets of them because the entire party was having fun with them. There was always someone tossing them at that big cottonwood round. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan Brown

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Throwing Hatchets
customer_reviews.text: Love this product ,great for throwing! The para cord will beak with a lot of throwing but an easy fix. I have so much fun practicing with these wonderful throwing hatchets. Very easy to land two out of three with every turn throwing. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy to throw
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and several other axes to try out throwing with friends. While these are small and light compared to the others I tried, they ended up being the most popular and easiest for folks to try out. Have now bought three sets to get friends started then have some bigger axes to progress to. Note - needs extra paracord to repair the handles when you damage them, regardless great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rob M

customer_reviews.title: A must have for throwing
customer_reviews.text: My son and I .. just started throwing .. these are great for starters.. they are very well balanced and lightweight and great for throwing .
customer_reviews.author: wesley s.

customer_reviews.title: Fun axe but lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Full tang throwing axe. Very lightweight. I've thrown a few hundred times and grips are toast. You'll need to re wrap grip with hockey stick grip or baseball bat grip. Case only hold one axe comfortably. You can get all three in there but not designed for three. All around a good time.
customer_reviews.author: Eli Bell

customer_reviews.title: Great fun-easy to throw
customer_reviews.text: The tomahawks are great and fun to throw. The only reason they didn't get 5 stars is that the paracord wrapped around The handle is already falling off one of the 3.
customer_reviews.author: JulieAnn

customer_reviews.title: Would reccomend
customer_reviews.text: Full tang solid construction. Looks like the paracord on the handle will likely come off one day but that's ok I'll just put my own custom grip on it when that day comes.
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Kind of cheap. They started falling apart after a few throws. Not very sharp and too light to throw.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Mutz

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great set of throwing tomahawks. I really liked that they were one solid piece of metal, as I'm sure that will help them to be more durable.
customer_reviews.author: O'Dell

customer_reviews.title: Everything you would expect from a SOG product
customer_reviews.text: Exactly like it was described and typical excellent SOG quality. They set the bar for a quality product. Fun little throwing ax for the back yard parties. May buy another set for teams.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Wertz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for throwing!!!
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome! One part (full tang) construction. I have been throwing them daily for months. Well balanced, sturdy; I have had not one bend or warp. Occasionally, I have a nick, but nothing major.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Hardee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wish they weren't so thin but they stick good awesome for fun!
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: These are my husbands favorite throwing axes. Very sturdy and easy to throw. I’ve bought several of these sets and am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Johnson

customer_reviews.title: To lightweight and small for us
customer_reviews.text: Alil lighter than we are used to. Definitely takes practice with these...they are pretty small compared to what we are used to. To lightweight for us.
customer_reviews.author: Twin2

product_meta.title: SOG Tomahawk Pack of 3 - Throwing Hawks Throwing Axe Set and Full Tang Tactical Hatchet Pack w/ 1.75 Inch Blades and Camping Axe Sheath (TH1001-CP), 9in. x 1.5in. x 12.5in., Black
product_meta.description: Throwing knives can be tricky, so SOG developed these expertly balanced Throwing Hawks to deliver a satisfying stick to beginners and pros alike. SOG Throwing Hawks are crafted in full-tang stainless steel with a hardcased black finish to provide long-lasting durability, and are wrapped in balance-neutral paracord you can easily remove and/or replace - because the blades are going to last awhile. We would like the above-written product description to appear on the listing as requested.
feature_bullets: 3 Stainless Steel Throwing Tomahawks: Each hardcased black throwing hatchet in this throwing axe set features 1.75-inch full tang tactical hatchet blade; tomahawk pack
10.75 Inch Full-Tang Construction: Flimsy axes and hatchets are dangerous! This SOG tomahawk outdoor set is built to last and comes as sharp as any other SOG tactical tomahawk

Throw and Stick Easy: 25.4 oz. survival axe set is perfectly balanced for beginners or pros with superior grip and full-on fun right out of the box; these 8.4 oz. throwing axes feature removable paracord handles for your preferred grip/wrap

All-in-One Ballistic Nylon Hatchet Sheath: Carry your throwing hatchet set in one convenient 3-pocket throwing hatchet sheath; secure each tomahawk throwing axe in the camping axe sheath with Velcro straps
SOG for Life: Take care of your axes and hatchets and we’ll take care of you; we gladly consider repairs and replacements for your properly maintained SOG tomahawk throwing hatchets

specifications.Included Components: SOG Throwing Hawks TH1001-CP - Set of 3, Hardcased Black Stainless Steel with Paracord Wrapped Handle, Nylon sheath, 1.75" Blade
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,414 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
